� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
This module is for con?guration of the secondary air system.
For SC1 projects:
Data  Value  
 NC_NR_SAP [1] 
 
1 = One secondary air pump is available 
2 = One secondary air pumps are available 
NC_NR_BK_SA [1] 
 
1 = One bank is available 
2 = One bank are available  
NC_NR_BK_SYS_SA [1] 
 
1 = One secondary air bank in system is available 
2 = One secondary air bank in system are available 
NC_NR_PRS_SA_SAMPLE_ACQ [5] 
Number of samples for pressure sampling 
NC_PRS_SA_CONF [1] 
System configurations flag (compiler) if a PRS_SA 
sensor is available (=1) or not (=0)

The required lambda during SA active can be calibrated as a function of mass air ?ow, engine speed,

65.5.2 Calculation of lambda deviation factor FAC_LAMB_DE_SA
Description:

SAIR, Catalyst heating correction with secondary air
The deviation of lambda can be calibrated as a function of load and secondary air mass ?ow during the
warm-up.
At the end of secondary air injection the values FAC_LAMB_DE_SA and LAMB_SA_CH must be reset to 1, to
deliver correct values to other functions.
LAMB_SA_CH will only take into consideration if catalyst heating is active (LV_CH = 1).
In order not to get a to lean / rich mixture for the combustion, LAMB_SA_CH is limited by C_LAMB_SA_CH_
MIN / MAX.
To calibrate the combustion lambda not the pre-cat lambda then LC_SA_SWI_CMB has to calibrated to 1,
SAF_KGH is not considered. In this case all tables for LAMB_SAWUP_TMP calculation must be calibrated
"Rich".
In the following formula section, LAMB_SA_CH_i is used instead of LAMB_SA_CH [NC_CBK_EX_NR].
Formula section:
if LV_SAWUP = 0
then LAMB_SAWUP = 1
LAMB_SA_CH_i = 1
else FAC_LAMB_DE_SA = (MAF_CYL + SAF_KGH) / MAF_CYL
if LC_SA_SWI_CMB = 0
then LAMB_SA_CH_i = LAMB_SAWUP_TMP / FAC_LAMB_DE_SA
LAMB_SAWUP = LAMB_SAWUP_TMP
else LAMB_SA_CH_i = LAMB_SAWUP_TMP
LAMB_SAWUP = LAMB_SAWUP_TMP * FAC_LAMB_DE_SA
endif
if LAMB_SA_CH_i >C_LAMB_SA_CH_MAX
then LAMB_SA_CH_i = C_LAMB_SA_CH_MAX
else If LAMB_SA_CH_i <C_LAMB_SA_CH_MIN
then LAMB_SA_CH_i = C_LAMB_SA_CH_MIN
endif
endif
endif
65.5.3 Lambda setpoint for end of line test secondary air
Description:
If EOL test is active the lambda setpoint is LAMB_SP_SA_EOL.
Formula section:
if LV_ACT_SA_EOL = 1
then LAMB_SP_SA_EOL = C_LAMB_SP_SA_EOL
else LAMB_SP_SA_EOL = 1
endif

C_TCO_DIF_MIN_SA - 0... FEH 0... 190.5 0.75 �C
TCO difference to reset the SA restart counter
� FUNCTION DESCRIPTION:
� General information:
An overheating of the secondary air pump is possible at frequent successive engine starts. To prevent the
secondary air pump from damage an overheating prevention is started.
Therefore the engine coolant temperature is stored in EEPROM as TCO_STOP at each termination of engine
operation. At the next engine start the difference between TCO_ST and TCO_STOP is calculated. If it
is greater than C_TCO_DIF_MIN_SA the engine cooling is considered as suf?cient and the secondary air
function is activated normally, while the counter CTR_REST_SA (which is also stored in EEPROM at engine
stop) is set to 0.
If the difference is lower than C_TCO_DIF_MIN_SA at a new start the counter CTR_REST_SA is incremented
by one. As soon as CTR_REST_SA reaches the maximum permissible number of SA-restarts C_CTR_MAX_
REST_SA the secondary air function and diagnosis is disabled for this engine operation.
The bit LV_TEMP_MAX_SAP_COIL desribe the secondary air pump overheating.
� Application conditions
Initialization: after reset: LV_TEMP_MAX_SAP_COIL = 0
Reccurence: once
Activation: at transition LV_ES 1 = > 0 (before SA-function)
Deactivation: if activation condition is not fulfilled

SAIR, Coordination of secondary air mass ?ow determination
65.7.1 Coordination of secondary air mass ?ow determination
� General Information
The calculation of the secondary air mass ?ow is required for the calculation of the lambda set point.
Following the determination of the secondary air mass ?ow value through the model is described.
Subsequently the actual secondary air ?ow is determined from the model calibration (SAF_KGH_MDL) .
Description:
The secondary air mass ?ow is a function of the total air mass ?ow, engine speed, battery voltage, ambient
pressure and the ambient temperature. In consideration of the deviation (SAF_DIF_AD) the secondary air mass
?ow will be corrected.
The secondary air mass ?ow is ?ltered, as follows. It will take into consideration the start of the secondary
air pump (the ?ll-up of the SA-system - very inert) and the ?fast change? of secondary air mass ?ow during
unsteady conditions.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: at RST
SAF_KGH_MDL_CLC = 0
SAF_KGH_MDL = 0
SAF_KGH = 0
T_DLY_SA_ACT = 0
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
Determination of secondary air mass flow
if(1) (one element of LV_SAV[] = 1) and LV_SAP = 1
then(1)
SAF_KGH_MDL_CLC = IP_SAF_MDL(MAF, N) * IP_SAF_COR_VB(VB)
* IP_SAF_COR_AMP(AMP) * saf_cor_tam * SAF_DIF_AD
Filtering of the mass flow considering the secondary tube filling.
if(2) T_DLY_SA_ACT < C_T_DLY SA_ACT
then(2) T_DLY_SA_ACT = T_DLY_SA_ACT + 0.01s
SAF_KGH_MDL(i) = SAF_KGH_MDL(i?1)
+ (SAF_KGH_MDL_CLC - SAF_KGH_MDL(i?1)) * C_CRLC_SAF_ST
else(2) SAF_KGH_MDL(i) = SAF_KGH_MDL(i?1)
+ (SAF_KGH_MDL_CLC - SAF_KGH_MDL(i?1)) * C_CRLC_SAF
endif(2)

SAF_KGH_MDL_CLC = 0

tester.

trolling is deactivated.

SAIR, State machine for secondary air system diagnosis
65.12 State machine for secondary air system diagnosis
� Data De?nition
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
LV_CDN_DIAG_SA_SAV_ENA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Condition to release the leakage check
LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_OFS_SA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Transition from measurement phase to offset
LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_VLV_SA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Transition from measurement phase to valve
LV_RAF_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Interruption of the air fuel ratio check during the ?ow check (Offset phase)
LV_SA_DIAG_3_EVAP_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis has been interrupted in the valve leakage check phase on demand of canister purge function
LV_SA_DIAG_CH_TMP V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
End of catalyst heating during measurement phase
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_DYW O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis is in the measurement window during the phase to determine the secondary air mass
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_END V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Measurement phase of the secondary air monitoring has ended
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis has been interupted in the secondary air mass determination phase
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Measurement phase has been completed in the required time
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_SAP_OFF V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Secondary air pump has been switched off in the measurement phase
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_2_DYW O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis is running within the measurement window during the valve leakage check phase
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_2_END V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The secondary air valve leakage check phase ended
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_2_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The secondary air valve leakage check phase has been interrupted
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_2_OK O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The secondary air valve leakage check phase has been completed in the required time
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_2_T_MAX V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Maximum time for the secondary air valve leakage check phase has elapsed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_21_DYW O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Bank individual valve leakage check (Bank 2) - system within the required measurement window
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_21_END V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Bank individual valve leakage check (Bank 2) completed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_21_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Interrupt of the secondary air valve 2 leakage check
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_21_OK O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The bank individual valve leakage check (bank 2) has completed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_21_T_MAX V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Maximum time for the bank individual valve leakage check (bank 2) has elapsed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_22_DYW O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -

Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
Bank individual valve leakage check (Bank 1) - system within the required measurement window
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_22_END V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Condition to complete the bank individual check of the secondary air system
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_22_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Interrupt of the secondary air valve 1 leakage check
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_22_OK O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The bank individual valve leakage check (bank 1) has completed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_22_T_MAX V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Maximum time for the bank individual valve leakage check (bank 1) has elapsed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_END V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis phase to determine the offset has been completed accordingly
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_INTR O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis has been interupted in the offset phase
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_OK O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Offset determination phase has been completed in the required time
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_T_MAX V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Maximum time for the offset determination phase has elapsed
LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_CMPL O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The state machine has been passed through once
LV_SA_DIAG_START O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The secondary air system diagnosis is in start state.
LV_SA_MASS_MES O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The diagnosis phase for calculation of secondary air mass is active.
LV_SA_PHA_2_ACT O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis is in the phase checking the valve tightness
LV_SA_PHA_21_ACT O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The phase bank separate activation of secondary air valve is active. (Phase 21)
LV_SA_PHA_22_ACT O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
The phase bank separate activation of secondary air valve is active. (Phase 22)
LV_SA_PHA_3_CDN O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Condition for diagnosis phase for determination of offsets. (Phase 3)
LV_SA_SENS_DIAG_OFS O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Diagnosis is in the phase determining the offset
LV_SAP_ACT_PHA_2 O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Activation of the secondary air pump for the secondary air valve leakage check
LV_SAV_ACT_PHA_21 O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Activation of the secondary air valve 1 for the leakage check on bank 2
LV_SAV_ACT_PHA_22 O/V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Activation of the secondary air valve 2 for the leakage check on bank 1
LV_VLV_1_TRAN_MES_SA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Transition from measurement to valve 1
LV_VLV_1_TRAN_ST_SA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Transition from valve 1 to start
LV_VLV_1_TRAN_VLV_2_SA V 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Transition from valve 1 to valve 2

SAIR, Secondary air pressure sensor diagnosis
65.17.1 Calculation of the inhibition ?ags for the electrical and plausibility diagnosis of
the secondary air pressure sensor
� General Information
This speci?cation contains the description of the electrical diagnosis of the secondary air pressure sensor
made for ERRM8/UDGI
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST and IGKON : LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA = 0;
LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_1 = 0
T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK = 0
T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1 = C_T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1
PRS_SA_MES_MMV = PRS_SA_MES
At ERU2ES: T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK =
C_T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK
At RST VP_PRS_SA_MV = VP_PRS_SA[0]
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
Inhibition of the electrical secondary air pressure sensor diagnosis:
LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA = not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_PRS_SA))
VP_PRS_SA_MV = (1 - C_CRLC_VP_PRS_SA_MV) * VP_PRS_SA_MV
+ C_CRLC_VP_PRS_SA_MV * VP_PRS_SA[0]
Inhibition of the secondary air pressure sensor plausibility diagnosis:
PRS_SA_MES_MMV = (1 - C_CRLC_PRS_SA_MES_MMV) * PRS_SA_MES_MMV
+ C_CRLC_PRS_SA_MES_MMV * PRS_SA_MES
T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK = T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK - dT
If LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA Or
not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK)) Or
(not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_3)) And
(not(ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_2)) Or
LV_ACT_EOL))
Then LV_INH_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_1 = 1
Else LV_INH_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_1 = 0
Endif
If LC_SA_DIAG_ACT = 1 And
LV_INH_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_1 = 0 And
File: 15A0MD01.00D

LV_SA_PLAUS_REST = 0 And
T_DLY_ERU_ES_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK = 0 And
(LV_ES = 1 Or
(LV_SAP = 0 And
LV_ACT_EOL))
Then If T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1 >0
Then T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1 = T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1 - dT
LV_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_CDN = 0
Else LV_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_CDN = 1
Else T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1 = C_T_DLY_SA_DIAG_PLAUS_1
LV_DIAG_PRS_SA_PLAUS_CHK_CDN = 0
65.17.2 Diagnostics of the secondary air pressure minimum and maximum limits
� General Information
The purpose of this diagnosis is to monitor if the pressure sensor voltage stays within its
reasonable range.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST and IGKON :
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
Monitoring of the maximum limit:
If LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA = 0
Then IF VP_PRS_SA_MV >C_VP_PRS_SA_MV_MAX_DIAG
Then LF_STATE_DGO_TMP = 3 (CDN+SYM) (Failure detected)
Else LF_STATE_DGO_TMP = 1 (CDN+NO_SYM) (No failure detected)
Endif
Else LF_STATE_DGO_TMP = 0 (NO_CDN) (Condition for diag. not ful?lled)
Endif
The diagnostic result is send to ERRM Universal diagnostic interface
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(NC_IDX_ERR_PRS_SA_H;LF_STATE_DGO_TMP;STATE_FIL_TMP)
Monitoring of the minimum limit:
If LV_INH_ERR_PRS_SA = 0
Then IF VP_PRS_SA_MV <C_VP_PRS_SA_MV_MIN_DIAG
Then LF_STATE_DGO_TMP = 3 (CDN+SYM) (Failure detected)
Else LF_STATE_DGO_TMP = 1 (CDN+NO_SYM) (No failure detected)
Endif

� Function Description
RBM for SA_SYS
If bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SA_SYS[i] = 0
Then
If ACTION_ERRM_GetLvEndDiag(NC_IDX_DIAG_SA_SYS[i], PRM_LV_END_DIAG)
Then bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SA_SYS[i] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SA_SYS[i])
Endif
Endif
The bit 1 will be handled by error management itself.
If bit 2 of STATE_RBM_SA_SYS[i] = 0
If LV_SA_TMR = 1
Then bit 2 of STATE_RBM_SA_SYS[i] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SA_SYS[i])
Endif
Endif
RBM for SA_SAV
If bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SA_SAV[i] = 0
Then
If ACTION_ERRM_GetLvEndDiag(NC_IDX_DIAG_SA_SAV[i], PRM_LV_END_DIAG)
Then bit 0 of STATE_RBM_SA_SAV[i] = 1
ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(NC_IDX_RBM_SA_SAV[i])
Endif
Endif

## Function
This Simulink diagram represents the logic for activating and deactivating the secondary air pump (SAIR) based on several input signals. It appears to be part of a system that coordinates all secondary air pump and valve control requests. The function essentially latches a signal to activate the secondary air pump and provides a means to reset (deactivate) it.

## Inputs
*   `LV_SA`: Logical signal likely representing the primary enable request for the secondary air system.
*   `LV_SA_CH`: Logical signal, the function or use-case is not clear based on the provided Simulink diagram.
*   `LV_SA_END`: Logical signal likely representing the end condition or deactivation request for the secondary air system.

## Outputs
*   `LV_SA_COMP_ACT`: Logical signal representing the command to activate the secondary air pump.

## Logic Flow
1.  **Input Gating (AND):** `LV_SA` and `LV_SA_CH` are combined using an AND block. This means both signals must be TRUE for the output of the AND block to be TRUE. The output of the AND is used to Set the SR Flip-Flop.
2.  **Set-Reset Flip-Flop (FF):** The ANDed signal from step 1 is connected to the SET input of the SR Flip-Flop.

**Input Gating (AND):** `LV_SA` and `LV_SA_CH` are combined using an AND block. This means both signals must be TRUE for the output of the AND block to be TRUE. The output of the AND is used to Set the SR Flip-Flop.
2.  **Set-Reset Flip-Flop (FF):** The ANDed signal from step 1 is connected to the SET input of the SR Flip-Flop. A TRUE signal here will SET the output (Q) of the flip-flop to TRUE, latching the activation request.
3.  **Reset Condition:** The `LV_SA_END` signal is connected to the RESET input of the SR Flip-Flop. A TRUE signal here will RESET the output (Q) of the flip-flop to FALSE, deactivating the secondary air pump.
4.  **Delay block:** A delay block using 1/z is connected to the output of the FF block (Q).
5.  **Output:** The output (Q) of the SR Flip-Flop, after going through the Delay block, is passed through a Gain block (v.6.4) and serves as the `LV_SA_COMP_ACT` signal. This signal then controls the secondary air pump activation.

In summary, the logic works as follows:  When `LV_SA` and `LV_SA_CH` are both TRUE, the flip-flop sets, activating the secondary air pump.  The pump remains active until `LV_SA_END` becomes TRUE, resetting the flip-flop and deactivating the pump.

## Logic Flow
1.  **State Transitions:** The diagram shows several blocks representing different states (indicated by `<state_tran>`). Each block has an input port (`V.6.4`) that receives the current state value.

2.  **Condition Evaluation:**  Each state transition block contains a "cond_if" block (`V.6.2`). This block evaluates a condition (`V.6.0`) based on the current inputs and feedback. If the condition is true (the "if" input is triggered), the state transition occurs.

3.  **Function Execution:**  When a state transition occurs, a corresponding function block (`fc()`) is triggered. These function blocks (e.g., `CLC_TRANS_MESS`, `CLC_TRANS_VENTIL`, `CLC_TRANS_OFFSET`) perform specific tasks depending on the new state. These tasks involve:
    *   Generating control signals for valves (`LV_VLV_*`).

    *   Setting internal diagnostic parameters.

4.  **Signal Routing:** Within each function block, the input signals are processed, and output signals are generated based on predefined logic (not visible in this overview).  For example, the `CLC_TRANS_MESS` function likely formats diagnostic information into a message. `CLC_TRANS_VENTIL` functions likely set the state of various valves based on the current state and diagnostic status.

5.  **Bus Merge:** All the `fc()` function outputs are collected and merged by the `BusMerge` block into a single bus signal `V.6.0`. This bus carries all the control signals and diagnostic parameters.

6.  **clc_transition Block**: The final output of the process is produced by the `clc_transition` block, `1`, and becomes an input to the process during the next cycle. This is the state of the entire state machine.

7.  **Feedback Loop:** The outputs from the function blocks are used as feedback signals in subsequent state transitions. This allows the state machine to react to the results of its actions. The overall state machine operates in a closed-loop fashion, continuously monitoring the system, executing diagnostic tests, and adjusting its control strategy based on the feedback it receives.

## Function

The Simulink diagram represents a state machine for Secondary Air Injection (SAIR) system diagnosis. It determines the logic for setting diagnostic flags and activating a pump (presumably the secondary air pump).

## Inputs

*   `<LV_SA_SYS_DIAG>`: System-level diagnosis flag.
*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK>`: Diagnostic Phase 1 OK flag.
*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_END>`: Diagnostic Phase 1 End flag.
*   `<LV_FLOW_SA_L_MIN>`: Low flow signal.
*   `<LV_T_DLY_SA_END>`: Time delay flag.
*   `<LV_CDN_DIAG_SA_SAV_ENA>`: Condensation diagnostic save enable.
*   `<LV_DIAG_SAV_LEAK_CHK_END>`: Leak check end flag.
*   `<NC_NR_BK_SYS_SA>`: Not ready back system SA.

## Outputs

*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_INTR>`: Diagnostic Phase 1 Interrupt flag.

*   `<LV_T_DLY_SA_END>`: Time delay flag.
*   `<LV_CDN_DIAG_SA_SAV_ENA>`: Condensation diagnostic save enable.
*   `<LV_DIAG_SAV_LEAK_CHK_END>`: Leak check end flag.
*   `<NC_NR_BK_SYS_SA>`: Not ready back system SA.

## Outputs

*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_INTR>`: Diagnostic Phase 1 Interrupt flag.
*   `<LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_VLV_SA>`: Measurement transition Valve SA flag.
*   `<LV_VLV_1_TRAN_MES_SA>`: Valve 1 Transition Measurement SA flag.
*   `<LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_OFS_SA>`: Measurement transition Offset SA flag.
*   `<LV_SAP_ACT_PHA_2>`: Secondary Air Pump Activation Phase 2 flag.

## Logic Flow

1.  **Phase 1 Interrupt:** The `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_INTR>` output is set based on a combination of `<LV_SA_SYS_DIAG>` and `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK>`. Specifically, `<LV_SA_SYS_DIAG>` is inverted, `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK>` is inverted, these two are ANDed together, and then ORed with the original value of `<LV_SA_SYS_DIAG>`.
2.  **Transition Measurement VLV SA:** The `<LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_VLV_SA>` is directly driven by the `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_END>`, `<LV_FLOW_SA_L_MIN>`, `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK>`, `<LV_T_DLY_SA_END>`, `<LV_CDN_DIAG_SA_SAV_ENA>`. When there is a `<mess_reset>` signal, the values pass through.
3.  **Transition Measurement Valve SA:** The `<LV_VLV_1_TRAN_MES_SA>` is directly driven by the `<LV_DIAG_SAV_LEAK_CHK_END>`, `<NC_NR_BK_SYS_SA>`. When there is a `LV_VLV_1_TRAN_MES_SA` signal, the values pass through.
4.  **Transition Measurement Offset SA:** The `<LV_DIAG_MES_TRAN_OFS_SA>` is conditionally set. It depends on the output of the following logic:
    *   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_END>` AND `<LV_FLOW_SA_L_MIN>`.
    *   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_1_OK>` AND `<LV_T_DLY_SA_END>`.
    *   The outputs of these two AND gates are ORed. This signal acts as the 'enable' input to a 'Unit Delay' block (`V.6.1`).
5.  **SAP Activation Phase 2:**
    *   The output of the 'Unit Delay' block acts as the condition for a "cond_if" block.
    *   If `cond_if` is true (i.e. `V.6.0` is non-zero), then the output `<LV_SAP_ACT_PHA_2>` is equal to 0 (`V.6.4`). Otherwise, it keeps its previous value (the dotted line suggests a feedback loop, although the source is unclear from the picture).
    *   The purpose of this block is to ensure that the <LV_SAP_ACT_PHA_2> is reset to 0 under the conditions set above.

## Inputs

*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_T_MAX>`: Logic signal indicating the phase 3 diagnosis timer has reached its maximum.
*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_OK>`: Logic signal indicating that the phase 3 diagnosis result is okay.

## Outputs
*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_CMPL>`: Logic signal indicating that diagnosis phase 3 is complete.
*   `<LV_RAF_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_INTR>`: Logic signal that can trigger an interrupt to inform of the results of the secondary air system phase 3 diagnosis.
*   `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_INTR>`: Logic signal that can trigger an interrupt to inform of the secondary air system phase 3 diagnosis.

## Logic Flow
1.  The diagram starts with four input signals: `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_END>`, `<LV_SA_SYS_DIAG>`, `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_T_MAX>`, and `<LV_SA_DIAG_PHA_3_OK>`.

## Function

The primary function of this Simulink diagram is to implement a timer for the activation of the Secondary Air (SA) system during a cold start in a single driving cycle. This system likely introduces air into the exhaust stream during cold starts to help the catalytic converter reach operating temperature quickly, reducing emissions.

## Inputs

*   **LV_CH:** A logical signal, likely related to cold start conditions or engine temperature.
*   **LV_SA:** A logical signal, likely indicating whether the SA system is currently active or should be activated based on other conditions.
*   **T_SA_ACT_in:** A logical signal, potentially a feedback signal that can deactivate or influence the timer.

## Outputs

*   **LV_SA_TMR:** A logical signal indicating whether the SA timer is active.  This could be used to enable the secondary air pump or valve.
*   **T_SA_ACT_out:** A timed signal which likely corresponds to the timer itself.

## Logic Flow

1.  **Input Signals:** The system takes three logical inputs: LV_CH, LV_SA, and T_SA_ACT_in.
2.  **AND Gate:**  LV_CH and LV_SA are fed into an AND gate. This means the output of the AND gate will be TRUE (high) only if *both* LV_CH and LV_SA are TRUE.
3.  **NOT Gate (Inversion):**  The output of the AND gate is inverted by a NOT gate.
4.  **Timer/Integrator (V.7.7):** The inverted signal from the NOT gate, combined with signal `T_SA_ACT_in` and the constant `C_T_SA_ACT` form the inputs to a timer/integrator block. The 'E' input is the enable signal, the 'R' input is the reset signal, the 'IV' input sets the initial value, and the 'x_in' input is the count input. The timer increments every 1 second (dT=1).
5.  **Timer Output:** The 'y' output of the timer block is then fed into another NOT gate.
6.  **Outputs:** The output of the NOT gate is the first output signal, LV_SA_TMR, the secondary air timer signal. The other output signal, T_SA_ACT_out, is the output of the timer itself.

## Function

The document defines the logic for the Secondary Air Valve test at End-of-Line (EOL). Specifically, it defines the activation conditions for starting and stopping a short test trip to check the secondary air system.

## Inputs

*   `LV_END_DIAG_SAV_PORT`: End-of-Line diagnostic save port.
*   `LV_ERR_SA_SYS`: Error status of the secondary air system.
*   `LV_IGK`: Ignition Key On.
*   `LV_N_SP_IS_EOL`:  Something related to speed or position indicator during EOL testing.
*   `LV_ST_END`: End-of-Line test status.
*   `MVB_EOL`:  Measure Value Block EOL (likely a trigger from a diagnostic tool).
*   `STATE_CP`: State of the Control Program

## Outputs

*   `LV_ACT_SA_EOL`: Activation bit for the secondary air EOL test. This appears to be an indicator rather than an output in the classical Simulink block sense.

*   `ACTION_SAIR_StartShortTripActSa()`: Start short trip for secondary air system check. This is an action, but serves functionally as an output by initiating the test.

*   `ACTION_SAIR_StopShortTripActSa()`: Stop short trip for secondary air system check. Similar to start, this is an action acting as an output to stop the test.

## Logic Flow

1.  The document defines the action `ACTION_SAIR_StartShortTripActSa()` that will start the test trip only if the following conditions are met simultaneously:
    *   `LV_IGK = 1`: Ignition is ON.
    *   `LV_ST_END = 1`: EOL testing is in progress/status is End
    *   `LV_N_SP_IS_EOL = 1`: Likely indicates that certain pre-conditions regarding engine running speed and/or vehicle position are met at end-of-line.
2.  The document notes that the test is activated either by an automatic routine (Function 04) requesting measurement block 200 or using the VAG-tester in function 04, measurement block 77 or 78.
3.  The documentation also explains that during the test, simultaneous activation of the accelerator and brake pedals sets the idle speed to a specific value and a torque limit is imposed.  Furthermore, the air conditioning is deactivated and the fuel tank ventilation valve is closed.
4.  Finally, the short trip test is activated and can run in the same driving cycle, only after the fault memory has been cleared.
